title: Garlic And Rosemary Grilled Snapper
summary: Garlic And Rosemary Grilled Snapper is a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe with 1 servings. One serving contains 1219 calories, 189g of protein, and 41g of fat. For $16.23 per serving, this recipe covers 55% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. A mixture of basil leaf, garlic, pepper flakes, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so tasty. To use up the rosemary you could follow this main course with the Raspberry Brie Dessert Pizza with Rosemary and Candied Pecans as a dessert. It works well as a pricey main course. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. It is brought to you by Recipezaar. The Fourth Of July will be even more special with this recipe. Overall, this recipe earns a tremendous spoonacular score of 83%. Try Garlic and Rosemary Grilled Snapper, Grilled Steak with Rosemary and Garlic, and Grilled Leg of Lamb with Garlic and Rosemary for similar recipes.
instructions: Trim extra fins and tail off of your fish.Sprinkle salt and pepper over the entire inside and outside of the fish.Combine the first seven ingredients, and mix well.I like to smash the herbs and spices in my mortar and pestle.If you don't have a mortar and pestle, finely chop the ingredients together on your cutting board.Stuff fresh herb and spice mixture into fish's cavity, rub any extra over both sides of the outer skin.Top fish with lemon or lime slice (if using).Grill whole fish for about 7 minutes on each side or until cooked through.Remove fish from grill, and carefuly remove filets from bone to serve.

steps.step: Trim extra fins and tail off of your fish.
Sprinkle salt and pepper over the entire inside and outside of the fish.

Combine the first seven ingredients, and mix well.I like to smash the herbs and spices in my mortar and pestle.If you don't have a mortar and pestle, finely chop the ingredients together on your cutting board.Stuff fresh herb and spice mixture into fish's cavity, rub any extra over both sides of the outer skin.Top fish with lemon or lime slice (if using).Grill whole fish for about 7 minutes on each side or until cooked through.
Remove fish from grill, and carefuly remove filets from bone to serve.
